skill.name: auth-handler
skill.description: Manage authentication, authorization, and user sessions. Use when dealing with login, sign-up, API protection, middleware, or user data fetching.

skill.author: AayushBaniya2006

security_audit.summary: Pure prompt-based skill providing authentication best practices for NextAuth v5. No code execution, no filesystem access, no network operations. All capabilities described (withAuthRequired, useUser, auth helpers) are legitimate authentication patterns.

content.value_statement: Managing user authentication across a Next.js application requires careful handling of sessions, route protection, and authorization checks. This skill provides standardized patterns for NextAuth v5 including middleware protection, frontend hooks, and server-side auth utilities.
actual_capabilities: Protect API routes with withAuthRequired and withSuperAdminAuthRequired wrappers
Implement frontend user data access using useUser() hook
Access server-side session data via auth() function from @/auth
Add cron job authentication with cronAuthRequired utility
Configure NextAuth providers and adapters in auth.ts
Apply defense-in-depth with middleware and route-level protection
limitations: Does not create new authentication providers or strategies
Does not modify database schema for user models
Does not handle password reset or email verification flows
Does not integrate with third-party auth services beyond NextAuth configuration

use_cases.title: Protect API endpoints
use_cases.description: Add authentication checks to serverless functions and API routes in Next.js applications

use_cases.title: Access user session data
use_cases.description: Retrieve authenticated user information in React components using standardized hooks

use_cases.title: Implement auth best practices
use_cases.description: Apply defense-in-depth patterns with middleware and route-level authorization

prompt_templates.title: Basic route protection
prompt_templates.prompt: Use withAuthRequired to protect this API route so only authenticated users can access it.

prompt_templates.title: Admin route protection
prompt_templates.prompt: Use withSuperAdminAuthRequired to protect this admin-only endpoint.

prompt_templates.title: Frontend user data
prompt_templates.prompt: Use the useUser() hook to access the current user's data in this client component.

prompt_templates.title: Server-side auth check
prompt_templates.prompt: Import auth from @/auth and check the session before performing this server-side operation.

output_examples.input: Protect this API route so only authenticated users can access it
output: Apply withAuthRequired wrapper to the route handler
Access session data via the second argument: { session, getUser }
Never skip route-level protection even with middleware
For super admin routes, use withSuperAdminAuthRequired instead

best_practices: Always use route protection wrappers even when middleware exists
Use useUser() hook for frontend, never useSession from next-auth/react directly
Access server-side user plan with getUserPlan(session.user.id)
anti_patterns: Relying solely on middleware without route-level protection
Using useSession from next-auth/react in client components
Assuming session.user contains full user data (it is minimal)

faq.question: Which AI tools support this skill?
faq.answer: Works with Claude, Codex, and Claude Code. All tools that can read and follow prompt instructions.

faq.question: What authentication providers are supported?
faq.answer: Any provider configured in NextAuth v5. Common providers include Google, GitHub, Credentials, and more.

faq.question: How does this handle super admin routes?
faq.answer: Use withSuperAdminAuthRequired wrapper. It checks against SUPER_ADMIN_EMAILS environment variable.

faq.question: Is user data safe when using this skill?
faq.answer: Yes. The skill only provides patterns for accessing existing auth data. No data is stored or transmitted externally.

faq.question: How do I debug authentication issues?
faq.answer: Check auth.ts configuration, verify providers, and ensure AUTH_SECRET is set correctly in environment.

faq.question: How is this different from NextAuth directly?
faq.answer: This skill provides standardized patterns and best practices. NextAuth is the underlying library. Use both together.
